page.title: 16USES OF HISTORIC BUILDINGS
page.content: The{White Fathers}missionary society occupy the{Lodge}and opened a student hostel in 1966 but this changed in 1980,to become an imformation and fund raising centre.They help the local parishes and visit schools to inform pupils of their work in Africa.The priests at the lodge are T.Dooley, R.Kinlen,J.Tolmie,A.Gardner and F.Dickson.Its location near motorways helped the priests to travel quickly through central Scotland.School visits are also arrangedto the Lodge. There are several{historic houses}in the area although Craig Park has been demolished for the quarry.Norton House is used as a hotel;Ratho Park House is a golf club;Bonnington is used as the headquarter's of Murray International Metals and Ratho Hall and Ashley are still private houses.
